comment.author: 44048553@N03
comment._content: Este Erik Brate (1857-1924)  debió ser un pionero de la fotografía.

comment.author: 35965204@N07
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Viking Art, and we'd love to have this added to the group! Thorskegga

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
Gonmi: 
Dr. Erik Brate was not a professional photographer, but a scholar who used photography in his scientific work. His field was linguistic science and he was also an expert on runes. He took a lot of pictures of rune stones - several presented in our set Ancient monuments here on Flickr Commons. Hope you like them :)

Dr. Erik Brate no era un fotógrafo profesional, sino un estudioso que utilizó la fotografía en su trabajo científico. Su campo era la ciencia lingüística y también era un experto en runas. Tomó un montón de fotos de piedras rúnicas - varios presentados en nuestra serie Ancient monuments aquí en Flickr Commons. Esperamos que os gusten:)

/Anna B.

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content: RegiNP: According to the scientific interpretation, the picture shows to the left the priest at the altar with some of the sacred objects for the communion in his hand, and to the right the congregation. See some more photos of the Sika Rock Carving in our photo database: www.kms.raa.se/cocoon/bild/object_list_simple?query=sikah... Gonmi: Dr. Erik Brate was indeed also a pioneer, since he was the first scientist to use photography in his research on rune stones. / Dr. Erik Brate era de hecho también un pionero, ya que fue el primer científico en utilizar la fotografía en sus investigaciones sobre las piedras rúnicas. /Anna B.
